thread.title: Snow and ice warning still in place - and temperatures to drop as low as -3 degrees Celsius tonight
thread.title_full: Snow and ice warning still in place - and temperatures to drop as low as -3 degrees Celsius tonight

author: Keith Kelly
title: Snow and ice warning still in place - and temperatures to drop as low as -3 degrees Celsius tonight
text:
Snow and ice warning still in place â€“ and temperatures to drop as low as -3 degrees Celsius tonight
Met Ã‰ireann has forecast â€œwetter than averageâ€ conditions for next week as a Status Yellow snow and ice warning expires for five counties today.
The warning for counties Cavan, Donegal, Monaghan, Leitrim and Sligo is valid until noon and brings with it dangerous driving conditions and icy stretches.
According to its extended range forecast, Met Ã‰ireann said low pressure in northern parts of Europe will lead to â€œwetter than averageâ€ rainfall with â€œabove normalâ€ temperatures for this time of year.
As for the remainder of this week, it is set to turn â€œunsettledâ€ with spells of rain.
Today has begun very chilly, but dry, in many parts with the arrival of clear, sunny spells in the later morning and early afternoon.
Temperatures will reach between 3C and 7C.
A very coldðŸ¥¶ but mostly dry start this morning apart from a few showers dying out over the W & N.â˜”ï¸
â€” Met Ã‰ireann (@MetEireann)
Crisp sunshine will break through this morning with plenty of clear & dry weather for this afternoon & evening.ðŸŒ¤ï¸
HighsðŸŒ¡ï¸ of only 3 to 7Â°C in a cold northerly breezeðŸƒ.[pic.twitter.com/pVl8TbvNCf][November 20, 2025]
Tonight will turn very cold again, with temperatures dropping to as low as -3C.
Tomorrow will start cloudy as rain picks up along Atlantic counties with temperatures of 5C to 9C. By night, that rain will spread eastwards over the rest of the country, becoming heaviest in the west with temperatures of 1C to 4C.
Saturday will be a slightly milder day nationwide with temperatures between 6C and 10C, rain clearing east in the morning as dry weather takes hold in the afternoon. Heaviest showers will be across Munster and southern Leinster.
On Saturday night, overcast conditions will prevail as as showers break out along eastern counties, turning heavy at times with lowest temperatures of 3C to 6C.
Sunday will see rain gradually clear away during the morning, but it will remain cloudy until the afternoon when sunny spells develop, mostly across the south. Daytime temperatures will reach between 7C and 10C, dipping to 0C to 4C at night.
